The short ribs I chose were amazing, so tender they fell apart at the touch of the fork, and the avocado chicken curry my wife selected was even better. Hope to make it back before we leave town!

Tried this place the other day. Meh. 
Service was ok but the kitchen got way behind with only about 1/4 of the restaurant full. The waitress had to apologize several times. She also had to apologize because her manager kept asking her to come back to our table and try to get us to buy some more drinks...which we didn't want. 
Prices are high for Thai food around here. $16 for curry? Better be the best curry in town... Except it so isn't. 
Which brings me to the food. Wife had some sort of seafood soup that was wayyyyy too sweet. She dumped about a half gallon of soy sauce into it trying to balance it out; never got there because it was becoming salty. 
I ordered the sweet curry, which was indeed sweet...but way too thin. Like water thin. Had it been reduced by 50% it would have had a lot more flavor and would have actually adhered to the veggies and chicken. 
Spice level, when ordered "Thai hot" was reasonably spicy, not outrageous and not wimpy like a lot of places. 
No chance we'd return, there is just nothing about this place that stands out.

The food is not good. I prefer a more traditional Thai restaurant with more authentic Thai food cooked by a Thai chef instead of a Hispanic Thai chef. If you are not used to authentic Thai food then you may be ok eating here. The yellow curry had no flavor and the poritons were really small and overpriced. The only reason I went to SaBai was becasue my usual authentic delicous Thai restaurant is closed on Sundays. This was not worth the $$$$$.
Would not recommend eating here.

SaBai Dii!!  

Located in a Wendy's building and it was a nice set up inside!  They had a huge bar table (some type of brown stone)  in place of where the register area would be.  As usual, I have to try their steak salad.  The owners were there and greeting and serving.  I got to try their "house" soup which was in some kind of chicken broth with soy sauce, lot's of white pepper and chunks of veggies.  Decent.  I had asked for the steak salad not to be so runny because it can be made really wet and/or too spicy and I just don't like it!  And probably because my mom makes some of the BEST Thai steak salad ever and every Thai restaurant I test to see how theirs match up to hers!  It was good not the best, but I would get it again for sure.  It's more Americanized than some other Thai places however, it was good.  I hope it stays around!

Wow. I can't believe this place has such good reviews. Either that or I just had the unfortunate luck of my first and only experience tonight with a horrible server  . I have worked in the service industry for ten years and went here with a former employee/ now manager of a restaurant. It is the first time we have ever left a zero dollar tip. Our female server rushed us over to a table, threw down menus, never even greeted us, and then hounded us to order (we got there at 9 on a tues, when they close at 10). So after rushing our order someone else brought our food out and we literally never saw our server again. I had ordered a drink, and wanted more but never had the opportunity to order one. We then watched as our server was spotted playing on her iPad at the bar. We had to yell out to her to please come over and bring us our check. It's a shame because the food was good, but I will never be back.

Went on Sunday evening it was quiet. Had good customer service and the food was great. Depending on appetite; able to take home leftovers for a second small meal. I will be back again. Smaller menu but as a vegan was able to still find options.

Yummmm! I am so glad we decided to come here on our brief visit to Phoenix! My husband and I both LOVE Thai food and since there seemed to be so many places in the area, we went with the one closest to our hotel with the best rating. What a find! The food was excellent, wonderful service and a decent price! I especially loved that they had sake on the menu...an extra treat! I got the pad thai which was delicious and my husband had the Chee Choo seafood which was outstanding. We both wanted to lick our plates at the end of the meal. I highly recommend this restaurant if you're in the area and hungry for some delicious Thai food full of mouth-watering flavors! If I lived close by I would go weekly for sure.
Always great food especially the classic chicken curry and the Spicy noodles. For apps try the wings they are awesome

Attentive staff and yummy food. The prices aren't too bad and the portions are always American size. You have to try the coconut curry chicken hot pot. There was some throwback Rihanna and J-Lo mix music that went really well with my spicy noodles.

Good food! I always order out though... because the service is a little slow and don't always have it together. They always say "we just opened for business recently and are still working things out as we go" They have been open for about 2years now I think. Kinda funny!

I don't live in Phoenix, so I don't really know what the general standard is for Thai food here, but this place wasn't very good.  I ordered the spicy beef salad and the tom yum soup, and ordered both medium spicy.  Neither dish was spicy at all, the beef was overcooked and underseasoned, and the tom yum soup was too salty and lacked substance.  It was basically shrimp broth with some sliced mushrooms.  Service was good, but everything was definitely overpriced, especially for the quality of the dishes served.  Very disappointed.

Some of the best Thai food I've had in Arizona. I had the Basil Chicken level 4 spicyness which was delish but not spicy enough. Next time I'll try level 5 Thai hot. The chicken satay appetizer was a little dry, but the sauce was great. The service was great as well.

SaBai Thai has become my new go-to place. I absolutely love the dishes, the service, the ambiance, and the overall experience!

This Wendy's converted building is quite deceiving. The inside is beautifully modernized and offers a nice, clean, upscale, and accommodating atmosphere. At night, when the lights go down and the candles are lit, SaBai Thai is a perfect spot to take a date. 

They have an EXCELLENT happy hour, but their normal drink prices are incredibly reasonable as well. I can't tear myself away from the $4 bottle of Sake ($1 off beers/spirits and $5 glasses of wine on HH). I generally sit up at the bar to shoot the shit, but happy hour is good throughout the restaurant. 

As far as food is concerned, I am absolutely addicted to the lettuce wraps (tofu easily substituted) and the classic yellow curry, but the SaBai Fried Rice and the eggplant dish are delicious as well. 

The staff is incredibly friendly, especially Chris and the owner Eric who you can see bopping around from table-to-table making sure the guests are taken care of. His wife, Holly, mans the back of the kitchen and together they have created the perfect Modern Thai environment.

In additional to the great atmosphere, delicious high-quality food, great drink prices, outstanding happy hour, warm and attentive service, they also have GREAT hours, especially for an Asian restaurant. Most Thai places close from 3-5 and don't do Sunday lunch service. SaBai Thai's modern take grants us Thai lovers action all day long, 7 days a week!

I think even Mr. Sheen would agree, SaBai Thai is a WINNER!!!

My husband and I had been on the road since Saturday afternoon and we finally had settled in to our hotel room and Yelped where we wanted to have our first dinner during our stay.
Yelp reviews rated this little place as high as the one we had eaten at last time and I was craving me some yellow curry.  We called ahead because its Easter. So with fingers crossed (but understanding if it was closed) we'd hoped they were open. 
Oh my! Not only were they open, but the employees were happy. They seated us right away, went over the special, and took the time to answer and inquire of the questions we asked. 
We started out with Satay (4 with sauce and a slaw type salad and the cucumbers were delicious) and crab wontons (6 of those don't seem like that many but they are plenty). 
Now my husband and I are pretty healthy eaters and I have to say that my eyes were way bigger than my stomach. Unless you are going to share appetizers or make the appetizers your meal, I recommend only getting ONE. We chose the two and continued with the Mussaman for him and for me.... The classic curry... Each with some steamed rice. His must have been pretty tasty as he was able to finish ... Mine ... Fantastic ... But I was so full from the appetizers, I could barely get half done. We boxed it up and I had a yummy snack at the hotel.
We hadn't ordered drinks (the water was very refreshing and adding the cucumber slices was amazing) but we did notice they had a nice selection of alcohol.
The place only served about 6 tables but I am pretty sure it was because of the holiday. We noticed they also had a drive through. I don't see any reason why this is not a packed house on most nights. The prices very reasonable our ticket was only 45 bucks. Everything was nice and clean and the waitress was very good at letting us know where our order stood. 
There is no second chance at the parking lot. If you miss it the first time just simply drive around the block. The entrance is right before the building. The road after is the exit road.
Thank you for our Easter Dinner!

My wife and I went here on a whim after hearing about them from the car wash next door. The place was incredibly quiet...one person at the bar, no one in the dining room. We were promptly seated, and looked over the menu, settling on satay and littleneck clams to start with, then the mussaman and curry for entrees. The littleneck clams were very tasty, and the broth lively and sweet. The chicken for the satay was moist and tender, perfectly seasoned with a peanut sauce with a surprisingly light texture. I ordered my mussamon hot, but not Thai hot, and the spice gave me a workout. We finished it off with a mango mousse cake that had my wife and I fighting for the last bite. Nettie's service was friendly and warm, and definitely gave us a good reason to go back.

Delicious Thai food! Must try the Avocado green curry and the pad see ew! You can choose the level of spiciness for each dish so we enjoyed the mild spiciness of both dishes. The avocado green curry was creamy filled with vegetables and chicken. As for the pad see ew, my husband ordered that for himself but I kept finding myself picking off his plate. Hahaha. I'll probably be getting my own order next time we go back.
Excellent Thai food! Everything I've had there is delicious. A word of warning, sometimes medium spice is on the spicy side. Otherwise great!

The food was overpriced for something you get so little of and the food tasted like it was frozen not fresh. Service wasn't great but there was only one guy doing everything. Of course everyone has their own opinion. This is mine

My good friend introduced me to this spot when I first moved to Arcadia. I love all their food there and order at least once a month from them. If you're ever in the mood for soup, I highly recommend their wonton soup. :) Their Pad Thai is awesome and so are their noodle dishes.

Nice, quiet location (at least while I was there), dim and romantic.  We had an avocado chicken dish over rice - sorry I can't remember the name of it but it was so good.  I also had a thai iced tea which was so refreshing! I had never had one and was instantly a fan!

Hate to say it, but average thai food. Ive eaten a lot of thai food all over the country, so maybe a little biased here. I like thai food, I feel like its one level up from chinese, but one level up down from korean. I assume asian food has different levels you have to graduate to.

Ordered to go, no silverware. You read that right, no silverware. Got silverware from the hotel. Was a little annoyed that they didnt supply the necessary tools. Lessons learned, will pack silverware when I travel. So Im given an extra star for that inadvertent travel tip.

Ordered the seafood curry and it looked delicious but tasted very bland, we had to add sugar and fish sauce to make it edible. The pleasant waitress reccomended the spicy chicken as a special whch turned out to be the same sauce and style of Pandas Orange chicken and at $18.00 for orange chicken? Perhaps we came in at a bad day or did not order the right dishes? This place may be over rated. Service was spectacular! Food not!

Really bad. One star is generous for the food, which is the grossest and worst "Thai" food I've ever had. Our waitress disappeared and we didn't want to attempt to explain to the busser who barely spoke English that Thai curry shouldn't have the consistency of grandma's gravy. It was thickened, I guess with corn starch, and the curry sauce jiggled like jello. So, so gross. Do yourself a favor and don't go here.

More like Chinese than Thai, sugary and  bland.   None of the bright, clean spicy flavors one expects from Thai Food.

In the Spicy Fried Noodles  I could not detect the advertised Thai basil, or other flavors, and there were huge chunks of jalapeno complete with seeds instead of the promised poblanos.   The noodles were soggy and had very little in the way of vegetables or protein, just a big huge serving of flabby noodles with no flavor.  I don't think they used any fish sauce, which is a foundation for authentic Thai food.

The lettuce wraps are bland, the chili sauce that comes with them is just sugar sauce, and the peanut sauce is watery. 

 And way too pricey.

I can make better Thai food at home.  It's really not that difficult if you have the right ingredients and care, even just a little bit.
Yum yum yum.... but the Google reviews are way off.... that pad Thai was delicious.... keep up the great work... best in Phoenix award.... 2016...

The ladies in my department and I ordered here through Grub Hub.  I can't speak to their experiences with their order but I ended up getting Pad Thai and their crispy Thai rolls.

The Pad Thai was OK.  I found it to be on the slightly sweeter side but it was good enough to satisfy my Thai cravings.  The crispy rolls were pretty unique to me as I've never tasted anything like that before.  The filling was an unusual blend of veggies but I still liked it enough to finish the order.

I would not order from here by myself but if the group decides to get Thai again, I will probably join them.  There are other Thai places I would choose first over this.

Honestly, this place could be a 4 1/2 or 3 1/2 depending on how you see what happened.  I'll put it this way though, its not the foods fault!  It was delicious, but I learned a valuable lesson.  When ordering food, be clear while on the phone.  Make sure they repeat the order for you and you'll be fine.  MINOR ISSUE.

Actually, she got everything right except for adding chicken to my spicy fried rice with vegetables, thats it(even got how spicy I wanted it off a 1-5 scale).  I'd give it a 4 1/2 cause its a lil pricey at $10 -12 a plate, but they're filling portions cooked exceptionally well.

I have been ordering food from Sa Bai since the first week they opened on Thomas Rd, a long time. Over the past year, changes have frustrated me and I've told them, but the feedback doesn't seem to matter. We like the Pad Thai, and at $13 for mostly noodles, it's expensive. So when they decided to drop the 3 shrimp that came with whatever meat you ordered on it, I thought that was pretty cheap. 
The last 3 times I've ordered this, I've picked it up, got home to find no peanuts. Tonight, I called, I ordered, and specifically asked if we had to ask for peanuts or if they stopped pouring them on. She said they do or them on. I explained they haven't the last 3 times and to make sure they made it in my order. She said she'd make sure the order had peanuts. We got home, no peanuts. I called, they put me on hold forever, so I gave up. Now I'm leaving a negative report, rather than a positive one, all because they either didn't listen to me, or didn't care enough to make my order the way I asked.

Food was fresh and tasty 
We ordered on line and pick up time 
was as promised
We will return!
I've only been here a couple times, but everyone is friendly and the food is fantastic. Seriously, the lettuce wraps are totally addictive!

I ate lunch with my husband at Sa Bai on a Friday.  Lunch specials are priced from $8-$10, which is $1-$2 per plate more than most other Thai places around town, so I was expecting some really decent food.  Alas I was sadly disappointed. I ordered the green curry beef jalapeno and my spouse ordered the spicy noodles with chicken. My green curry dish was simply not very good.  There was little beef or jalapeno in my curry, which consisted mostly of a gooey green curry base artificially thickened with cornstarch. My husband's noodle dish was much better, but unremarkable considering the price and small portion size. Both the dining room and bathroom were very clean and well kept, so Sa Bai impressed me as a nice place to maybe go on a first date, but I certainly won't be back for the food anytime soon.

Sai Bai never disappoints. 

I wish the size of the thai tea was larger, or they were cheaper.. because I accidently drink the entire thing beforw my food even comes. No self control! But please order this

As for food, I always go here for Lunch and their Lunch menu is reasonably priced and you get a big portion as well, so get ready for leftovers.
I love the classic pad thai, and any of their curries are amazing.
I love Thai, but this I consider unique Thai. Good stuff if you are in the area. Thai Basil!!

Pricey, but excellent! And I usually get two meals out of an entree. The green curry is awesome and the shrimp with peanut sauce is addicting. Shrimp was not overcooked and they had brown rice to substitute for white. Great modern atmosphere, small intimate feel. Good drink specials. Service was just ok, but I think it was just our server... Will be back for sure!
Best Thai food around! Pad see ew is my go to and is delicious every time! Cashew chicken is really good too! Not only do they deliver but they have a drive up window for pickup!

I am updating my review based on my last 2 orders.

Food all of a sudden is BLAND. No spicy or flavor at all. I had the Spicy Noodle (which is my favorite) and there was NO spice or flavor...AT ALL. My co-workers and I ordered from this place twice in the last moths, and we got the same experience, bland boring food. Nothing compared to the first times I went here. I don't know if they changed cooks, but, I am definitely not getting food from here again, until I hear there has been improvements. 




After living in Phoenix for 3 years, and seeing this little Thai Place so many times, I finally decided to stop by.

The place is medium sized, good ambiance, modern, and the service is quick and friendly.

I ordered from the lunch menu: Chicken Pad Thai, and the Spicy Noodle. To be honest, the pad thai was lacking flavor and color, it was bland. However, the Spicy Noodle was delicious! Garlicky and spicy, with veggies, egg and chicken with thick rice noodles...it was so good. I haven't tried anything else, but those 2 dishes; if you want a safe and savory plate, go for the Spicy Noodle.

my go to Thai food in PHX!! one of the Best in town as far as taste n servings. I make a point of stopping by at least once a week. their fried rice is exceptional. well worth the price n the wait, which is not terribly long.

I love love love this place!  I usually order out from here once a week, and love it!  Pad thai is incredible, so are the spicy noodles!  And of course, you have to try the crispy thai rolls!  Definitely a favorite!  I keep meaning to dine in some night as this place has super cool live bands, but haven't yet done it..  They also have fun Thai trinkets you can buy!

I wanted to update my review and say this place is still a top notch Thai place in Phoenix.  

For starters I had the Crab Wonton's which are a must.  They come with an amazing dipping sauce and have a generous amount of crab not Krab in them which is what makes the difference from a lot of these cheap places in town.  

For the entree I had the Seafood Hot Pot which is full of Shrimp, scallops, clams and calamari with tomatoes and sliced fresh mushrooms in a hot and sour lemon grass broth. I ordered it Thai hot which was great to open up my sinuses and keep my tummy warm : ).  

Everything from the food to the service at this place is top notch.  Don't miss out on this one.

On a solo evening with homework waiting for me I decided to try Saa Ba thai takeout.    One bite and I thought "Why, oh why, have I waited so long to try this place!  Yum!!!!"  I got pad Thai and they perfectly accommodated my no chicken/no onion/non spicy request.  And their sticky rice with mango was delish.  I no longer feel the need to drive way down to Wild Thaiger on Central (although I still like them also).    But I am so excited to have this neighborhood place!

The food was ok. The service was fast. I went mid day on a saturday and it was pretty empty hence the fast service. The atmosphere may be a lot livelier at night so if I'm ever in the mood for Thai on a week night I may stop by again.

Mid-sized restaurant built in what used to be a Wendy's fast food restaurant.. The setting is mildly romantic with dim lighting and candle lit tables and the service is a bit short-handed, but that's alright because they're pretty small in size.. I came here because I had a $25 certificate that could be used with a minimum dining bill of $35 from restaurants.com.. People magazine sent me an offer to get a free $25 voucher to any restaurant participating in the program so I figured it was worth trying.. Dishes run in the $12 range and our appetizer was $8.. I ordered the chicken/pork fried rice and it had eggs, toasted cashews, pineapple, onion, and other things.. My friend ordered the cashew chicken with white rice and we shared a satay chicken appetizer.. One of the things that I really enjoyed was the pickled cucumber that came with our appetizer.. It was so good that I asked for more! It was only meant to be a small side dish to compliment the appetizer but I loved it.. Both of our entrees were delicious and it was so good I didn't even save room for dessert.. I have never tried cashews before but thanks to Sa Bai Modern Thai I am now a fan! If I'm ever in the area again I would definitely return here..

I've been back many times since my last review.

The place is never too busy. It's clean. The staff are welcoming and friendly. The kitchen does an amazing job. The dishes are all prepared to order and the spice levels are accurate. The plating is elegant. The pricing if very fair.

It looks like any other typical fast- or fast casual from the outside. Once inside, it's more like a really good place to enjoy well-prepared Thai at reasonable prices.

Okay I must admit I now have tried SaBai about 4 times and it actually seems like it has gotten better.  I haven't tried anything beside the crab wontons and Pad Thai.  The food has become consistent which I think is the hardest thing for a restaurant to do. 

 I still stand buy that it is overpriced though.  But given the other choices and not wanting to drive to Tempe it will suffice.  I am willing to move from a 1 star to 3.

Brought the grandparents here in hopes of impressing them with some quality Thai food... too bad the service almost gave them an aneurysm. The awkwardly loud, clubbish music playing before sunset didn't help either. I was embarrassed when they complained to our waitress about it, but the fact that no one turned it down didn't help the situation.

When asked why our food was taking half an hour, the waitress blamed it on the fact that one of our dishes required grilled salmon. The restaurant was almost completely empty, and anyone who's ever grilled anything knows that that excuse is bullshittery. Redemption arrived in the form of green curry and pad thai, but not before my grandpa threatened to walk out (too bad DQ was his only other option).

Overall, the food was above average in its category (particularly the sauces), and I enjoyed the setting, but the lesson's been learned. This is probably not a family spot. I'd go back if I was with some friends in the area, but if the kitchen makes a habit out of taking their sweet time, I'm out.
I'm addicted to the ice coffee, coconut ice cream and the dark seafood soup with all the perfectlu cooked mushrooms.

Crazy busy street to walk on to get here.  You can tell this used to be a fast food joint.  On the outside, it is not so inviting.  GO INSIDE.  GO.  Lunch time was groovy.  The seafood soup is a coat of warmth.  I only did the broth.  The even leave the shells in it. LEGIT.  I am a carb loving fool.  Anyone that is happy in life knows that carbs are what makes the world go round.   RICE ME.  Yep.  I took that plate down like they were taking me to the electric chair.  Balls to the walls awesome.  I even ate it with chicken.  It is something I am trying, chicken.  Whatever.  It was super tender.  Veggie Heaven.  The best part, you ready.  I do this at home on my dishes.  FRESH BASIL.....on hot anything, breaks it down.  On the bite you devour, pops all in your head and just makes dining that much more enjoyable.  Service was groovy.  Huge lot for free parking, hard to come by in the PHX.  Valet here and there.  Give me a break.   I hate touristy crap.  So I was happy I found this spot.  Thanks Yelp.  Great Vacayyyy...Hey.
We started with fried crab wonton and ordered eggplant and fried rice as entree . The food was completely amazing but the service was not good compared to the quality of food.

Thanks to all the helpful yelp reviewers, my husband and I decided to try this place out before our flight from the Phoenix airport - and boy are we happy we did! The food was great, atmosphere was intimate without being sleepy, and the service was right on! I highly recommend this place!
I love this place! I have been here on ten different occasions and the food is always good. Service is great and everything tastes really fresh. They take the extra step to work with food allergies.

Just moved to this neighboorhood and trying to navigate through the many asian takeout options and find one I'll be loyal to going forward. This isnt going to be the one for me. 

I ordered take out online and the food was ready on time which was great. When i got home, I noticed that my yellow curry was looking kinda bland. the veggies included were undercooked and the rice on the side was actually completely crunchy and uncooked. Gross. I had an order of fried rice as well, so I ended up eating that and mixing in the chicken from the curry dish to make a big mixed dish. That was ok, so I never ended up complaining about the food to SaBai, but I must say that being able to cook rice should probably be something the restaurant has mastered by now - very disappointing. I think I'll try someplace else from now on.

Coming from LA where i see thai joints on every block, i decided to try this one out on my date. The food was really good! crab wontons were amazing!. I ordered the spicy noodle and the waitress asked me "do  you want american hot or thai hot?" and i chose american hot just to play it safe. I totally should have went for thai hot, seeing as i asked for some sriracha on the side and dumped it all over my food :)

The place was very cute, modern, and was not loud so i was actually able to hold a great conversation on my date. 

Definitely coming back here!
Quick service, friendly staff! Tried the spicy noodles with tofu today and it was delicious!!!
My boyfriend and I shared the Sa Bai sweet curry and pad Thai, both were very delicious!! The staff was very friendly and attentive, I will definitely come back.

Okay, I have visited SaBai a couple of more times since my first visit, so I feel comfortable updating my review, and upgrading to 4 stars!  Woot woot! LOL.  On this last visit I had the spicy noodles with chicken and veggies, and it was very tasty!  Not too spicy (and I like spice) and definitely not bland.  The veggie soup was very tasty as well!  I don't go to this place as often as I should, especially with their bomb $8 lunch specials!  I promise to do better.

Really delicious tai food. Haven't had tai food in a while so I thought I check this place out. The food here is really good I got the spicy SaBai fried rice which has pineapple and cranberries to add a sweetness effect to it. The springs rolls I really enjoyed with their peanut sauce, I think the peanut sauce was nice and warm which complimented the spring rolls perfectly. I had glass of the Tai coffee and being the coffee enthusiast I am I really enjoyed it.

This is the best Thai restaurant i've ever been to. I normally would order over the phone for a pick up. They are very friendly and they appreciate their customers dearly. I remember the first time I ordered their Sabai Fried Rice and I wanted to have yellow curry on the side but unfortunately they didn't serve it that way, so I didn't ask again. One day I order, which probably was a month later, I asked for the same order including the yellow curry on the side and they server said sure. She said, "I remember you asking before and I realized that would be a great idea because most customers want a side of curry." It was an extra $4 but it was worth it. 

I love this place and always recommend it to my friends who lives close to the area.

Again I went back to this AMAZING place where the food continues to be unbelievable.  They have excellent service, tasty starters and delicious mango mojitos.    If you want a very reasonably priced place to eat out, this is your spot.  So worth it!!!

Surprisingly delicious! I was always apprehensive about trying Thai food but it was delicious! I had the spicy noodles with vegetables medium heat. It was perfect. I wasn't expecting that balance of flavor! Can't wait to take my fiancé!! Service was efficient and polite.  Must have again!!

We went in on a Wednesday evening.  

It is a very casual place, but don't let that fool you.  

The food was wonderful and if you are worried about the food being too spicy, or not spicy enough- they make everything to order.  

We had terrific Tom Yum Soup, the lettuce wraps, Salmon Curry, Drunken Noodles and a chicken and avocado curry.  I would recommend any of these dishes. 

They have a full bar.

Best yet for all the food and drinks our bill was under $100.  Pretty amazing.

Sabai is new Thai restaurant located near the car wash that I visit in the Valley of the Sun.  I decided I would give it a try.  The inside definitely has a modern look with contemporary furniture and design.  The food is above average.  We ordered Larb Chicken Salad and Pad Thai.  The Larb Chicken Salad had a great tangy flavor, but the Pad Thai was okay.  I think the food was a bit overpriced because I am used to paying half the price for very authentic Thai food.  I guess you could say we paid for the decor and setting.  I might try this place again in the future when the menu expands to more items.

I have to review again... I am officially done with Sabai.  After a year boycott based on bad experiences, I gave them another try (only Thai delivery in area) and had 2 pretty good experiences.  Delivery has never come in less than an hour.  Today they said 45 minutes and took 90 minutes - which is totally unacceptable when they charge $5 for delivery.  Food was subpar - flavor was off and barely any veggies in fried noodles and the Thai rolls were literally 90% wrapper and 10% filling.  Too bad, we desperately need a good thai place in Arcadia

I have had 2 or 3 previous experiences that I really enjoyed taking out from here (obviously why I kept returning). My last time was very disappointing. Not only was my order not spicy at all (I ordered it hot) but I couldn't even eat it and ended up throwing $20 of food away. Major bummer. Really want to give it one more shot because of my previous great experiences with the same dish, but also nervous about the inconsistency.

This was quick choice I picked to go eat at with my family, but we were impressed. We ordered the spicy seafood soup(med spice) non spicy fried noodles and 3 Thai iced tea. 

The seafood soup was really good it was delicious. The spiciness was not overpowering it was perfect for us. We ate this with a side of rice. 
The fried noodles were to die for.The flavor was there and the noddles were cooked perfectly. We also enjoyed the Thai Iced tea, it was cold which I appreciated because some places give little ice with it. 

I would recommend this place, it is very pretty inside with plants growing on top of a window. Pictures inserted. Also to end this the food in my opinion was great!
Favorite Thai place. Love the Massaman curry- perfectly peanuty with some cinnamon essence, just as described. Any of the curries are enough for two meals. This is a gem of a place.
This place has the spiciest pad thai I have ever tried! It was full of flavor and delicious!!!

Open on a holiday 
Professional 

Wasn't expecting this type of experience. Hardly ever order take out, so I was just waiting for disappointment. I was taught to expect the opposite from now on. 
If you like the perfect amount of spice, order medium. And if you like eggs like I do, you may have to request extra. 
Whoever took my order, I appreciate you. Not only did you verify my address and make sure you had a gate code, you made sure my order was just like I wanted it. I didn't know the address at my current location and you waited ---patiently. Seriously, some people can just 5star an experience because they are just awesome. 
Even the man tastebuds gave "this is really good," and we all know that doesn't happen often.

Thank you:)

The food here is amazing!!!  My dad and I came here one day just to check it out.  We ordered two dishes, avocado green curry and a cashew tofu dish and shared both.  The food was SO amazing that we literally spent the entire meal discussing how great the food was!!!  Seriously?!  Avocado Green Curry?!  What?!  I've never heard of it before but now I can't imagine life without it!  My partner and I come here often and we love it!  We are both vegan and the staff is very accommodating and nearly everything can be made vegan and it's absolutely wonderful.  We celebrated our anniversary there because we love the food, staff and atmosphere!  Thank you SaBai!

I really want to love this place. But at the end of the day, the food is only OK.

They messed my order up the first time. I ordered the lettuce wraps and a chicken curry(around $16), and did not give me any rice for my curry. Thats ok, shit happens... they offered my next meal on the house.

Fast forward 8 months, I decided to give them another try.  Ordered the same thing. The curry is pretty good, but could use some more filler to go with the sauce(add more veggies/chicken) . The lettuce wraps didn't really have much chicken in them, but they were really tasty as well. On the whole, for the value, there are better places in town, but this is a pretty solid spot if you live next door.
